text: Anna Marie "Patty" Duke (December 14, 1946 - March 29, 2016) was an American stage, television and movie actress. She was born in Manhattan, New York City. Duke was married to actor John Astin and had two children; Mackenzie Astin and Sean Astin. In 1963, at age 16, Duke won the Academy Award for "Best Actress in a Supporting Role" for playing Helen Keller in The Miracle Worker. At the time, she was the youngest person to win the award. On March 29, 2016, Duke died of sepsis from a ruptured intestine in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho. She was 69 years old. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Actors from Queens Category:American activists Category:American autobiographers Category:American child actors Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Best Supporting Actress Academy Award winners Category:Deaths from sepsis Category:Disease-related deaths in Idaho Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Infectious disease deaths in the United States Category:People with bipolar disorder Category:Presidents of the Screen Actors Guild
title: Patty Duke
